text:
Pitino defiant amid escort allegations
LOUISVILLE, Ky. — Louisville basketball coach Rick Pitino remains defiant that his program will survive the allegations in a book by an escort alleging that former Cardinals staffer Andre McGee hired her and other dancers to strip and have sex with recruits and players.
Pitino said Tuesday that the Cardinals "will get through this the right way."
The coach says he understands the motivation behind Katina Powell 's book "Breaking Cardinal Rules: Basketball and the Escort Queen," but questions the need for the alleged activities given the talent his program has produced.
Pitino added, "We will find out the truth, whatever it may be, and those responsible will pay the price."
Soccer: Tim Howard made his first appearance in goal for the United States in 15 months and was unable to stop the Americans' slide. Joel Campbel l scored in the 70th minute, and Costa Rica beat the listless U.S. 1-0 in an exhibition in Harrison, N.J. Three days after a 3-2 loss to Mexico in a playoff for the region's Confederations Cup berth, the U.S. generated few scoring chances. ... Marc Pelosi and Jerome Kiesewetter scored second-half goals and the U.S. under-23 national team beat Canada 2-0 in the CONCACAF qualifying championship third-place game to continue its quest to qualify for the 2016 Olympics.
Tennis: Roger Federer lost his first-round match at the Shanghai Masters, 7-6 (4), 2-6, 6-3 to Spanish qualifier Albert Ramos-Vinolas Former U.S. Open champion Marin Cilic defeated Borna Coric 6-1, 6-2 in a second-round match. Other seeded players to advance included No. 9 Milos Raonic , No. 10 Gilles Simon , No. 11 Richard Gasquet and No. 12 Kevin Anderson ... Venus Williams rallied to beat Yuliya Beygelzimer 2-6, 6-4, 6-4 in the opening round of the Hong Kong Open. Former No. 1 Jelena Jankovic , second-seeded Angelique Kerber , No. 5 Samantha Stosur and No. 7 Caroline Garcia also advanced.
— Wire reports
